feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Best Practice to Block a Plant in SAP
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We have a scenario where multiple plants are maintained under a single company code:

Company Code: AN01

  • Plant P001 – Region X
  • Plant P002 – Region Y
  • Plant P003 – Region Z

Now, the company has decided to shut down operations in Region Y, and we want to completely block Plant P002 from being used in any transaction.

My question is:
What is the SAP-recommended best practice for blocking or deactivating a plant to ensure no further transactions are possible?
Should we just remove configuration entries, or is there a systematic way (e.g., blocking at plant level, customizing settings, etc.)?

Best regards,
Harshil Vaghela

RISE with SAP SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Issue Finding BAPI to Create Company Code Data for Business Partner (Tcode BP) in SAP ABAP
entry.content:
I’m working on automating vendor creation using Transaction Code BP.

So far, I’ve used the following BAPIs:

  • BAPI_BUPA_CREATE_FROM_DATA to generate the Business Partner number

  • BAPI_BUPA_ROLE_ADD_2 to assign the BP role

These calls successfully create the Business Partner and General Data. However, Company Code data and Purchasing data are not being saved in BP.

Can you please suggest the appropriate BAPI(s) that can be used to create or update Company Code and Purchasing data for the Business Partner?

entry.title: Selective Data Transition Made Simple: A New Take on SAP S/4HANA Moves
entry.content:
Migration approaches at a glance

Transitioning to SAP S/4HANA is a significant milestone for organizations aiming to modernize their ERP systems. The path to this transformation typically involves choosing among three primary migration strategies: Greenfield, Brownfield, and Selective Data Transition (SDT). Each approach offers distinct advantages and challenges, and understanding these can help organizations make the right choice.

Greenfield: Starting anew

Greenfield is a completely new implementation of the SAP system. It enables organizations to redesign their processes from the ground up, adopt industry best practices, and eliminate legacy complexities. While this offers a fresh start, it demands significant effort—requiring extensive resources, time, and robust change management to build a new system and migrate essential data.

Brownfield: Evolving the existing system

Brownfield, or system conversion, upgrades the existing SAP ERP environment to S/4HANA. It retains current configurations, customizations, and historical data, making it a good fit for organizations satisfied with their existing processes but ready to benefit from

the innovations in S/4HANA. However, it may carry forward inefficiencies and limit opportunities for streamlining.

Selective Data Transition: The hybrid option

Selective Data Transition offers a hybrid approach, combining elements of both Greenfield and Brownfield strategies. It allows organizations to selectively migrate specific data sets, business units, or processes, enabling a more controlled and flexible transformation. However, SDT often requires custom solutions, specialized tools, and support from experienced partners — making it a more resource-intensive endeavor than other migration paths.

Introducing SAP Business Transformation Center (BTC) – a standardized solution for Lean SDT

To make SDT more accessible, especially for scenarios that are relatively common or less complex, SAP introduced the Business Transformation Center (BTC). This cloud-based solution, part of SAP Cloud ALM, is designed to streamline and standardize aspects of SDT.

“We’re positioning the BTC in the spectrum between system conversion and new implementation,” explains Clemens Leider from SAP. “It supports customers who want a clean, easy, and straightforward path while still keeping the benefits of SDT.”

Key Features of BTC

 

  • Digital Blueprint: Provides a comprehensive overview of the existing SAP landscape, facilitating informed decision-making regarding data and process migration.
  • Data scoping and filtering: Enables selective migration (e.g., excluding outdated company codes or obsolete data).
  • Guided transformation process: Offers step-by-step guidance through the migration process, leveraging predefined templates and best practices.
  • Integration with SAP tools: Works in conjunction with tools like SAP Readiness Check, enhancing analysis and planning capabilities.

 

When BTC makes sense

BTC is particularly valuable for organizations that aim to simplify their migration journey. It works well when there’s a clear need to reduce data volume, processes are relatively stable, and minimal customization is required. It's designed for companies migrating from

SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA in on-premise or private cloud environments — especially those already operating within the SAP ecosystem.

However, BTC is not a one-size-fits-all solution. It isn’t suitable for highly complex transformations that span multiple source systems or require significant process redesign. Organizations with heavy customizations or plans to move to the public cloud edition of S/4HANA may also find its capabilities limiting.

 

Short overview

When the selective approach via SDT is the best way – and when BTC is better suited.

 

 

SDT only

SDT with BTC

Objective

Flexible, selective migration to SAP S/4HANA

Standardized, lean SDT variant (Lean SDT)

Data migration

Highly customized and granular control (e.g., company codes, time slices, specific objects)

Predefined filtering options (e.g., exclude company codes), but no full flexibility

Transformation complexity

High – suitable for carve-outs, mergers, consolidations, process harmonization

Medium to low – aimed at streamlined scenarios with low complexity

Custom Code & Prozesse

Custom code can be specifically analyzed, transferred or sorted out

No focus on complex custom code migration

System landscape

Supports multi-system conversions, e.g., combining multiple SAP instances

Only 1:1 migration of a single ECC system, no multi-source capability

Process harmonization

Possible, including deep reorganizations (e.g., chart of accounts, organizational structures)

Limited – only predefined transformation scenarios available

Public Cloud compatibility

Yes

No – only for on-premise or private cloud environments

Project duration & cost

Higher – due to customization

Lower – standardized and faster to implement

 

 

What’s Next for SAP BTC

SAP continues to enhance the Business Transformation Center to support a broader range of transformation scenarios. In the near term, features like time slicing and object-level scoping are planned to give organizations even more control over what gets migrated and when. Looking further ahead, the roadmap includes advanced capabilities such as chart of accounts unification, account-to-ledger mapping, and extended validation support—all aimed at enabling more complex and finance-driven transformations.

For organizations considering  Selective Data Transition, it’s essential to evaluate their unique requirements and determine whether BTC’s scope aligns with their needs. When it does, BTC can accelerate the journey, making the transition to SAP S/4HANA smoother, more efficient, and more manageable

Explore more: Watch our webinar on SAP Business Transformation Center

entry.title: WebIDE time out
entry.content: We right-click on the Fiori project in the Full Stack Web IDE and select the Deploy option. Then, we proceed by choosing Deploy to SAPUI5 ABAP Repository. Next, we select the name of the connected system on BTP and continue. Finally, we choose the request on the system and start the deployment. However we got timeout error. We have increased the parameter HTML5.SocketReadTimeoutInSeconds. We have decreased the package size from 20MB to 4MB we didn"t get error. Is it related with the package size because it takes between 15-20 mins and it fails. Sometimes it is not failed and succesfully deployed.

entry.title: About mTLS connection between S/4HANA and APIGateway
entry.content:
In the configuration shown in the figure, we would like to have an mTLS connection between an on-premises S/4HANA and an APIGateway in the same network.
Is it possible to store the certificate in STRUST in S/4HANA and refer to it during authentication?

entry.title: Disable all options in dropdown list Tcode-VLMOVE and fix only one process
entry.content: We have requirement in VLMOVE t-code. When we select process there are multiple options available in the dropdown. We use option "transfer within plant (between storage location)" for our process but user mistakenly selects other option and then to reverse it we have to perform multiple steps which causes unnecessary delay, so we want to display the process "transfer within plant (between storage location)" automatically whenever we open VLMOVE to avoid any error. All other processes will be there in dropdown just our required one will be displayed automatically so that user does not have to select. Kindly provide a solution to achieve this

entry.title: SCM Consulting Solution Tools
entry.content:
Hello community,

I'm relatively new here and have already looked around a bit. However, I haven't come across any discussions about SCM consulting solution tools like MRPM (MRP Monitor) and IOC (Inventory Cockpit)

So my question is, is there anyone here who uses these tools, and perhaps also in combination with SAP S/4HANA ?

Are they still useful?

I would be interested in all of your experiences.

Thanks

Jan

entry.title: Modify VWPOS in a Enhancement to determine a new item category during sales order creation VA01
entry.content:
Dear SD and ABAP Experts,

There is a requirement in my project to modify the value of VWPOS during sales order creation to a new specific value (eg. ZJPC) which will be configured in "SPRO > Sales and Distribution > Basic Functions > Sales > Sales Documents > Sales Document Item > Define Item Category Usage" to enable item category to be determined as "TANN".

The Item Category determination configuration in VOV4 (or) "SPRO > Sales and Distribution > Basic Functions > Sales > Sales Documents > Sales Document Item > Assign Item Categories" will be also be configured with following values - 

Sales Order Type = ZOR, Item Category Group = NORM, Item Usage = ZJPC, Higher level item category = "Blank", Default Item Category = TANN"

To achieve this i would like to know which is the proper User-exit (or) BADI to implement this enhancement of modifying the Item Usage (VWPOS) field during sales order creation in S4 On-Premise system?

entry.title: The necessity of Migration Cockpit DMC_NOTE_ANALYZER
entry.content:
Hi There,

Based out of previous Data Migration experiences, there is a step of "Note Analyzer" to implement SAP Notes for DMC corrections.

And this was mainly to avoid unnecessary errors during Migration Cockpit data upload, which is already being resolved & published by SAP.

We would need your support to understand:

Do we really need this ?
How important this is to implement the DMC correction Notes?
how to proceed further ?

Thanks

Venkat

entry.title: RE-FX 'Interest Rate' under 'Valuation Parameters' tab is missing
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

Please help me find out what is missing for RE-FX contract balance sheet valuation setting?

I've already set it as below

  1. Activate Subfunctions: CE01 - Contract Valuation
  2. Setting Contract Dialog for Valuation Parameters and Valuation for contract type
  3. Setting Control Settings for Each Contract Type in Company Code (Direct balance sheet posting)
  4. Active Valuation Rule for company code and contract type 
  5. According to KBA: 3041660 - 'Interest Rate' under 'Valuation Parameters' tab is different from valuation,  not using the valuation behavior "C – net present value specification".

When I create a contract with the valuation parameter tab, I can add the valuation rule, but the interest rate field is missing.

And I've tried using fast entry mode to create a valuation rule, in the "Global Data' section can edit the interest rate, but after clicking the confirm button, it still doesn't work out for interest calculation.

Thank you very much

entry.title: Avoid creation of duplicate condition contract
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are using SAP S/4  HANA-2023 on premise. system is allowing to create duplicate condition contract (for same customer, same validity period & same conditions). there is no duplicate entry check if there is an identical condition contract.

Can you please check what configuration is required to avoid creation of duplicate condition contract?

Thank you,

Rahul

entry.title: Derivation of Profitcenter in PM-Order
entry.content:
When creating a PM-Order the Profit center is taken from Material master. When a responsible Cost center is entered it should overwrite Profit center from Material master with Profit center of responsible Cost center. But it doesn't work.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Translation of Notification for Workflow (Flexible Workflow)
entry.content:
Dear,
the flexible workflow functionality in sales creates push notifications in the Fiori Launchpad. The texts of these push notifications can be changed in transaction SWDD_SCENARIO, e.g. for Workflow Scenario WS01800180 (sales orders without charge) the push notification for the release of a sales order without charge (task id TS01800245) can be changed. For example, the change of the notification text including sensitive information can be changed and will be saved in database table SWFSNOTIF_TXT. 

However, I am only possible to maintain such a notification text in different languages by signing into SAP GUI with the needed langugage. For example, I need to sign in with French to change the push notification text in French. Is it possible to maintain translations for push notification texts in a more convenient way?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Multiple schedule lines getting clubbed
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have observed an issue, and would like your assistance. While creating a contract lets say 3010000010 - Line item - 10 -

Schedule line 1 - 10 qty and date 19.07.2025

Schedule line 2 - 10 qty and date 19.08.2025

Schedule line 3 - 10 qty and date 18.09.2025

With reference to this contract we try creating a sales order - in this sales order we observe that the 3 schedule lines are getting copied as one schedule line with date 19.07.2025 and qty 30. 

We need the schedules to be copied from contract to sales order without getting clubbed. 

Would you please let us know how to achieve this solution?

Regards

entry.title: WS533 Error during SD Settlement – Tax Code Not Determined
entry.content:
Hello,

When performing the final settlement of a customer condition contract via transaction WB2R_SC, I encounter the following error: WS533 – Tax code could not be determined via pricing; check customizing.

Context:

  • Transaction: WB2R_SC

  • Contract type: 25 – Customer Condition Contract

  • Action: launching the final settlement

  • Source documents: 3 sales orders

  • Pricing procedure is correctly maintained in the contract

Findings:

  • Both the customer and the material master data contain the relevant tax information

  • The source sales orders include the ZTAX condition, which is calculated correctly

  • The error occurs only during the final settlement

  • No lines are generated in the settlement document

Question:
Has anyone faced this issue in a similar scenario? Any ideas on how to fix or bypass this issue?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: Random Error message when performing time confirmation in find order operation F2173
entry.content: When  we try to perform time confirmation in find order operation app F2173 without any value in the personnel number field, the resulting error message  which is random and does not have enough  explanation for the details of the error. We need to have a clear message indicating the personnel number in the time confirmation is missing. Do we have amy OSS note to fix this problem.
